span.span: If you have questions that are not addressed in the links above, please contact your child's principal (Grades K-5) or guidance counselor (Grades 6-12).

div.p: View the 2020-2021 School Budget Presentation to learn how the budget supports the mission and vision of Ridgewood Public Schools. The school budget will be on the ballot on the Annual School Election on May 12, 2020.
The Annual School Election will be held on Tuesday, May 12, 2020 and will be conducted solely via vote-by-mail ballots.
Ridgewood Public Schools has been honored with the Best Communities for Music Education designation from The NAMM Foundation for its outstanding commitment to music education.

div.style: background-image: url('/UserFiles/Servers/Server_207516/Image/Our District/Office of the Superintendent/Dan Fishbein.jpg');

div.p: Read Dr. Fishbein's March column - School budget supports the district's mission and vision
Learn more about Census 2020 and the importance of a complete count.
Ridgewood Public Schools announces its new Communication Protocol. This valuable resource will help all stakeholders navigate the channels of communication.
It's not too late to register for Kindergarten! Complete the online registration forms, and sign up for kindergarten orientation.
RHS announces National Merit Scholarship results; Ashby Award winner is Laura Fleming and Tradition of Excellence Award winner is Sue Christopher!

Board meets on May 4, 2020 at 7:00 p.m. Due to the health concerns related to COVID-19, this meeting will be conducted virtually. An Executive Session will be held at 4:00 p.m. on April 23, 2020.
VIEW MORE About Board meets on 5.4.2020

img.p: The Ridgewood Public Schools, committed to a tradition of excellence and innovation, in partnership with the community, provide a rich and challenging learning environment, enabling students to maximize their unique potential to become lifelong learners and productive, responsible citizens.
